intro: Physaria vitulifera, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Physaria vitulifera is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native range.
